zygnema.gloss: type genus of the family Zygnemataceae

zygnemataceae.gloss: pond scums: common freshwater algae forming green slimy masses

zygocactus.gloss: small genus of Brazilian cacti having flat fleshy usually branched joints and showy red or pink flowers followed by red fleshy fruits

zygocactus truncatus.gloss: South American jointed cactus with usually red flowers

zygoma.gloss: the slender arch formed by the temporal process of the cheekbone that bridges to the zygomatic process of the temporal bone

zygomatic.gloss: the arch of bone beneath the eye that forms the prominence of the cheek

zygomatic arch.gloss: the slender arch formed by the temporal process of the cheekbone that bridges to the zygomatic process of the temporal bone

zygomatic bone.gloss: the arch of bone beneath the eye that forms the prominence of the cheek

zygomycetes.gloss: class of fungi coextensive with subdivision Zygomycota

zygomycota.gloss: division of fungi having sexually produced zygospores

zygomycotina.gloss: division of fungi having sexually produced zygospores

zygophyllaceae.gloss: small trees, shrubs, and herbs of warm arid and saline regions

zygophyllum.gloss: usually tropical herbs or shrubs having ill-smelling foliage and flower buds that are used as capers: bean capers

zygophyllum fabago.gloss: perennial shrub of the eastern Mediterranean region and southwestern Asia having flowers whose buds are used as capers

zygote.gloss: (genetics) the diploid cell resulting from the union of a haploid spermatozoon and ovum (including the organism that develops from that cell)

zyloprim.gloss: a drug (trade name Zyloprim) used to treat gout and other conditions in which there is an excessive buildup of uric acid

zymogen.gloss: any of a group of compounds that are inactive precursors of enzymes and require some change (such as the hydrolysis of a fragment that masks an active enzyme) to become active

zymology.gloss: the branch of chemistry concerned with fermentation (as in making wine or brewing or distilling)

zymolysis.gloss: a process in which an agent causes an organic substance to break down into simpler substances

zymosis.gloss: a process in which an agent causes an organic substance to break down into simpler substances

zymurgy.gloss: the branch of chemistry concerned with fermentation (as in making wine or brewing or distilling)

zyrian.gloss: the Finnic language spoken by the Komi

zygomorphic.gloss: capable of division into symmetrical halves by only one longitudinal plane passing through the axis

zygomorphous.gloss: capable of division into symmetrical halves by only one longitudinal plane passing through the axis

zymolytic.gloss: of or relating to or causing fermentation

zymotic.gloss: of or relating to or causing fermentation
